definition: to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
language/culture/writing/formal/literary/gentle/(old) classifier for coins/Kangxi radical 67
surname Wen
surname Guo
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(experienced action marker)
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: The opposition dismissed the report as a whitewash.
sentences.chinese: 反对党认为这份报告文过饰非不予理会。

sentences.english: You should admit and correct your mistakes rather than cover them up.
sentences.chinese: 有错误就该承认并改正，你怎么能文过饰非呢？

sentences.english: False, that is exaggerated, insincere, courteously but without sincerity, cover-up.
sentences.chinese: 假，就是夸大其词，言不由衷，虚与委蛇，文过饰非。

sentences.english: The opposition claimed the report was a whitewash.
sentences.chinese: 反对派声称这份报告文过饰非。

sentences.english: Kelly described the failure of the report to recommend criminal prosecutions as a complete whitewash.
sentences.chinese: 凯利还称这份提出刑事控诉的报道文过饰非。

definition: to pretend that everything is going well
to put the blame on sb else
to confuse right and wrong (idiom)
to carry out one's duties perfunctorily/to fulfill one's responsibility
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
the king looked left and right and then talked of other things/to digress from the topic of discussion (idiom)
pinyin: wang2 gu4 zuo3 you4 er2 yan2 ta1

definition: faked decoration
to shut one's eyes and stop one's ears/out of touch with reality/to bury one's head in the sand
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
lit. to cover one's ears whilst stealing a bell/to deceive oneself/to bury one's head in the sand (idiom)
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
to paint/to whitewash/to decorate/plaster/fig. to gloss over/to cover up
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
